The diagram depicts issues that contribute to the poor performance of hub-based LAN's. Initially six hosts are connected to a hub. As a result, network bandwidth is shared by six hosts. Hub-based LAN performance issues include:

- Lack of scalability: Another hub is connected to the first one, with six more hosts attached. The same network bandwidth is now shared by 12 hosts.
- Increased latency: With additional hubs, network latency increases.
- More collisions: With additional hosts, network collisions increase. There is still one collision domain.
